page.title: 08New Forest-Reafforestation 1
page.content: Within the inclosures in this area can be found various types of conifers or softwood trees. These are{Douglas Fir, {Corsican Pine, Scots Pine, Larch, {Sitka and Norway Spruce.}After planting, these trees grow to 25 years of age and are then thinned on a 5 year cycle up to approximately 50 years. From 50 to 80 years is the optimum time for felling. After this the growth rate decreases. 80% of the stock is felled and the remaining 20% is left growing in a scattered pattern. Each group to be felled covers a subcompartment, which in the New Forest is just over a hectare. These areas are replanted with softwood or hardwood trees. There are experiments with{natural regeneration where the area underneath existing trees is reseeded so these are growing when the large trees are felled.{Cont>
